answers.author: Mark Levin
answers.text:
The first question to be answered is: what is the purpose of the evaluation? Manager evaluations can be any or all of the following: Fulfilling a contractual obligation, providing meaningful feedback and suggestions for improved performance, providing a forum for an open and honest exchange, providing individual elected officials an opportunity to be critical, or counting your votes. 
Form follows function.

answers.author: Wes Hare
answers.text:
I have always preferred to include opportunities for directors (immediate subordinates) as well as council members to comment on my performance, but I am unconvinced that there is a widely accepted best process for evaluations.  I would recommend talking with the council about what they want after providing them information about what you and your HR director think works well.  I have always had my evaluations conducted in open work sessions, which I'm sure violates accepted practices and common sense.  I have fond memories of one that was televised.

answers.author: Curtis Davis
answers.text:
I developed an evaluation tool that had me list my major job responsibilities.  I then had to evaluate myself as to strengths and weaknesses and what goals should be in for the upcoming year.   I submitted the completed form to all of council.  Each council member then used the same form to evaluate my strengths and weaknesses and goals.  We then met to discuss where we agreed and disagreed.  From that meeting benchmarks  and goals were established for the year and that was used as part of the evaluation process for that year. 
It also forced discussion among council members on what topics should be foremost on my agenda.

answers.author: Eric Levitt
answers.text:
The City Council many years ago felt that the typical evaluation did not meet their desire to evaluate on the qualities they hired a City Manager under.  They asked that staff put together a specific type of evaulation for a City Manager.  We found few examples out there, so the staff created a specific evaluation.
I can get you the eval. if it would be helpful.

answers.author: John Holman
answers.text:
I am working on developing a Township Manager Evaluation process with my Board. I would like to have any samplpe policies that may be available. The main purpose is to improve communications and help detemine where the Board perceives additional training and effort on the part of the manager would help move the Township forward.
This would certainly help me as the manager to understand the concerns of the Board in greater depth. 
I have been the manager here for nine years and enjoy the support of the Board. We are making this part of our strategic planning process.
